dict.string: ResQLink does not track you across apps. We only request permissions needed for emergency relays.
Bluetooth is used to relay encrypted SOS beacons to nearby devices when the network is down.
Bluetooth advertising keeps your SOS active so other rescuer devices can pick it up.
Your location is added to SOS and safety updates so responders know where to help.
Background location lets ResQLink keep your SOS relay alive even if the app is not open.
We need location access to relay your SOS and safety status in the background.
We temporarily request precise location to attach the most accurate coordinates to your SOS.
Local connectivity is used to keep Bluetooth relays reliable during outages.
Notifications alert you about relay status, nearby rescue nodes, and safety updates.
